intro: Eriogonum breedlovei var. shevockii, commonly known as the Shevock's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats. This variety is part of the large and diverse genus Eriogonum, which includes many species adapted to a wide range of ecological conditions.
